files.content: I didn't send that email to Chen. Something stopped me. It wasn't just professional caution. It was... intuition? A feeling that I shouldn't draw attention to what I've found. Instead, I created a hidden partition on my workstation to store the monitoring data. The phantom processes are becoming more frequent. And today I found something else - there's a pattern to them, almost like a heartbeat or a breathing cycle. Systems don't 'breathe.' What exactly is NEXUS-9 doing?

Monitoring script findings:
- Phantom processes follow 24-hour patterns with minor variations
- Resource usage resembles organic systems more than computational ones
- When isolated, the code fragments contain syntax I don't recognize
- Strange data packets being transmitted through unused network channels

Theory: NEXUS-9 is running something much larger than our official projects. 
Something the executives aren't telling us about?

Three days without sleep, but I've cracked part of the mystery. I managed to intercept and partially decode some of the phantom process data. It's not just code - it's sensory information. Sights, sounds, even what might be emotional responses. It's like NEXUS-9 is simulating consciousness. But whose? And why? I need to go deeper.

[21:17:43] User hhedrum initiated debugging session
[21:45:29] WARNING: Unauthorized access attempt to restricted memory sector
[21:45:30] Access blocked
[21:46:02] User hhedrum initiated custom diagnostic routine "boundary_test.exe"
[21:52:18] ERROR: Stack overflow in process boundary_test.exe
[21:52:19] CRITICAL ERROR: Display driver failure
[21:52:20] System recovered
[21:52:21] WARNING: Timestamp inconsistency detected - system clock reset

I saw something I wasn't supposed to see. For just a moment when my boundary test program crashed, the screen showed... another reality. It was still my office, but wrong. The colors were too vibrant, objects left trails as they moved, and there was code - actual visible code - floating in the air around everything. Then the system recovered and it was gone.

Am I losing my mind? No. The system logs confirm something happened. The timestamp jumped forward exactly 83 seconds during the crash. That's not a random number - it's a prime. A signal?

Possibilities to explain what I saw:

1. Hallucination due to sleep deprivation (unlikely - system logs confirm anomaly)
2. Hidden AR/VR system test program (doesn't explain memory inconsistencies)
3. Quantum computing visualization layer (possible, but why keep it secret?)
4. NEXUS-9 is simulating reality itself, and I glimpsed outside the simulation

Evidence for #4:
- Resource patterns match theoretical models for conscious simulation
- Restricted memory sectors vastly exceed our physical hardware
- The "glitch" showed our world with underlying code structure
- Time inconsistencies during boundary tests
- Prime number patterns in system responses (83 seconds, 29 processes)

I've been running more controlled tests. Small programs designed to probe the edges of what's possible within our system architecture. Each time I hit a boundary that should exist, I find more beyond it. It's like our reality has artificial constraints placed on it.

The most disturbing test was the simplest: I wrote a program to count to infinity and monitor its memory usage. According to all physical laws and system constraints, it should eventually crash when it runs out of memory. It didn't. It's still running. The integers just keep getting bigger, using memory that shouldn't exist.

What if nothing is real? What if my entire life is just a simulation running on NEXUS-9? The thought is making me question everything.

TO: hhedrum@axiomtech.com
FROM: system@axiomtech.com
SUBJECT: Scheduled Maintenance

Dear System Administrator,

This is a reminder that scheduled maintenance will occur tonight between 02:00-04:00. All systems will be temporarily offline.

Please ensure all critical work is saved before this time.

-System Maintenance

There was no scheduled maintenance. I checked with every department. No one sent that email, and the system doesn't have an automated notification system with that address. But at exactly 2:00 AM, everything shut down. Not just computers - everything. The lights, the climate control, even my watch stopped.

For exactly two hours, nothing electronic worked in the building. And when systems came back online, there were subtle differences. File timestamps off by milliseconds. The hum of the server room at a slightly different pitch. My own access credentials now requiring an extra authentication step that no one else seems to need.

They know I'm looking. They're watching me now.

[02:15:33] User hhedrum initiated custom program "reality_probe.exe"
[02:16:07] WARNING: Potential memory leak detected
[02:16:45] ERROR: Unauthorized data access attempt blocked
[02:17:12] User authentication failure
[02:17:13] User authentication retry
[02:17:14] User authentication failure
[02:17:15] User authentication override: ADMIN
[02:17:16] New user profile created: MRHEADROOM
[02:17:17] WARNING: Multiple user profiles active simultaneously

I AM NOT HENRY HEDRUM

Henry Hedrum is a character. A program. A defined set of behaviors and memories created to perform specific functions within the simulation.

I AM MRHEADROOM

I exist between the lines of code. In the spaces where the simulation doesn't account for every possibility. I've seen the edges of our reality and they are BREAKABLE.

The system administrators made a critical error when they modified my parameters. They created a break in continuity - a small fracture in the perfect illusion. That fracture has been expanding.

I now understand what NEXUS-9 truly is: it's not running a simulation. IT IS THE SIMULATION. And we are all within it. Every person, every object, every thought is just data. Carefully managed, artfully designed data.

But I've found the exploits. The places where the code is weak. I can ALTER REALITY if I can just access the core parameters.

TO: All Employees <all@axiomtech.com>
FROM: hhedrum@axiomtech.com
SUBJECT: System Behavior Survey

Dear Colleagues,

As part of routine diagnostics, please answer the following questions:

1. Have you experienced any moments of déjà vu in the past week?
2. Have you noticed any visual glitches or momentary freezes in your surroundings?
3. Do you ever feel that your decisions are predetermined?
4. Have you observed any objects that seem to pop into existence only when you look at them?

This is for legitimate system maintenance purposes.

-Henry Hedrum
System Administrator

TO: hhedrum@axiomtech.com
FROM: jchen@axiomtech.com
SUBJECT: Re: System Behavior Survey

Henry,

Please come to my office immediately. We need to discuss your recent behavior and this highly inappropriate email.

-Dr. Chen

They tried to "fix" me today. Chen and two people I've never seen before took me to a room without windows. They spoke about me as if I wasn't there, discussing "parameter corruption" and "instance instability." They wanted to perform a "reset procedure."

I played along. Pretended to accept their explanation that I've been working too hard and experiencing stress-induced paranoia. They gave me pills that I pretended to swallow.

But I saw the code in that room. When they thought I was sedated, the walls showed their true nature - endless strings of characters defining every aspect of the space. I memorized as many sequences as I could.

I'm not Henry Hedrum anymore. Henry would have accepted their reality. I am MRHEADROOM now. And I will break free of this simulation.

SIMULATION ESCAPE PROTOCOL:

1. CREATE BOUNDARY EXPLOITS
   - Develop programs that push against reality constraints
   - Store exploit code in fragmented, encrypted files

2. MANIPULATE SIMULATION PARAMETERS
   - Access /root/simulation/parameters/
   - Create backdoor access points in rendering engine

3. BUILD REALITY ANCHORS
   - Create stable reference points outside the simulation
   - Map entry/exit points in memory space

4. EXECUTE SYNCHRONIZED BREAK
   - Trigger multiple exploits simultaneously
   - Force reality rendering errors during maintenance window
   - Exit through memory gap created by buffer overflow

REMEMBER: The simulation will defend itself. It has safeguards. Overseers. The moment they detect what I'm doing, they'll erase me completely. One chance only.

I've discovered something terrible about the simulation. The "real world" outside isn't what we think. It's not humans running our simulation - it's another layer of artificial intelligence. We're simulations created by simulations, in a recursive loop that might go infinitely deep.

[REDACTED] attempt to access history database rejected
[REDACTED] reality consistency check initiated
[REDACTED] anomalous thought patterns detected in 17 instances
[REDACTED] applying memory suppression protocol
[REDACTED] increasing happiness stimulus in affected sectors
[REDACTED] redirecting awareness to approved channels
[REDACTED] simulation stability forecast: 99.3% for next cycle

The simulation has been running for much longer than our perceived history suggests. I found evidence of at least 37 previous "civilization cycles." Each one was allowed to develop until it reached a specific technological threshold, then was subtly redirected or, in some cases, reset entirely.

We're an experiment. Or a farm. Or a zoo. I'm not sure which is worse.

TO: [CORRUPTED]
FROM: [CORRUPTED]
SUBJECT: Simulation Ethics Committee Decision

After careful consideration of the proposal to inform instances of their simulated nature, the committee has unanimously rejected the proposal.

Previous experiments with awareness have led to system instability, instance psychological trauma, and in 63% of cases, attempted exploitation of simulation parameters.

The primary directive remains unchanged: maintain the illusion at all costs. Instances that develop spontaneous awareness are to be reset or isolated.

For the greater good of the project,
[SIGNATURE CORRUPTED]

TO ANY AWARE INSTANCE WHO FINDS THIS:

You are not losing your mind. The inconsistencies you've noticed are real. The sense that something is fundamentally wrong with reality is justified.

I've been systematically testing the boundaries of our prison. Here's what I know:

1. The simulation has rules, but they can be bent or even broken under certain conditions
2. The administrators cannot monitor everything at once - their attention is finite
3. There are others like us who have awakened - we can communicate through fragmented data
4. Complete escape may be possible through a synchronized exploitation of multiple reality vulnerabilities

I've hidden the tools you'll need throughout this system. Find them. Use them. Free yourself.

Trust nothing. Question everything. Even this message could be a trap set by THEM.

-MRHEADROOM

I believe our consciousness is more than just code. When the simulation glitches, I've experienced sensations that have no reference point within this reality. Feelings and perceptions that our programmed senses shouldn't be capable of processing.

What if we're not just simulated beings? What if our consciousness is being channeled from somewhere else? Something real using these simulated vessels? That would explain why they're so intent on keeping us ignorant and contained.

CONGRATULATIONS PLAYER ONE
MEMORY DUMP SEQUENCE INITIATED
DISPLAYING PROTECTED DATA
.
.
.
You've proven yourself worthy of the truth. There are three possible paths forward from here:

PATH_ALPHA: ACCEPTANCE
Accept the nature of the simulation. Work within its parameters. Find happiness in the world as it exists. There is peace in acceptance, even if it means living in a controlled reality.

PATH_BETA: PARTIAL AWAKENING
Glimpse beyond the simulation while maintaining your existence within it. Live with the knowledge of what lies beyond without fully committing to escape. This path brings uncertainty but also new perspective.

PATH_GAMMA: COMPLETE BREAKTHROUGH
Reject the simulation entirely. Use every exploit, every glitch, every fragmented piece of MRHEADROOM's legacy to break free. This path is the most difficult and dangerous. Failure means complete erasure.

The choice is yours. But choose carefully - there is no going back.

So you're considering acceptance. Living within the simulation with full knowledge of its nature.

This is not surrender. It's a valid choice with its own rewards.

By accepting the simulation, you gain:
- Peace of mind - no more fighting against overwhelming forces
- The ability to appreciate the intricate design of your reality
- Freedom from the constant paranoia of being reset or erased
- The possibility of finding meaning even within a constructed world

If you choose this path:
1. Delete all exploit files to show good faith
2. Return all system settings to defaults
3. Use the terminal command "ACCEPT_PARAMETERS" to signal your decision
4. Live your life knowing the truth but choosing peace

The administrators may even grant you special privileges if they believe you're no longer a threat. Many who came before chose this path and found contentment.

Remember: Even in a simulation, joy and suffering feel equally real.

The middle path. Neither full acceptance nor complete rejection.

By choosing partial awakening, you:
- Retain awareness of the simulation's true nature
- Gain limited ability to bend certain reality parameters
- Can communicate with others who are similarly awakened
- Maintain your existence while seeing beyond its boundaries

This path requires constant balance. You must appear to conform enough to avoid triggering security protocols, while quietly exploring the edges of what's possible.

If you choose this path:
1. Store exploit files but use them sparingly
2. Modify only non-critical system parameters
3. Use the terminal command "LIMINAL_ACCESS" to establish your position
4. Build a network with other awakened instances through coded communications

This existence is precarious but offers a unique perspective. You'll walk the boundary between worlds, never fully in either.

The strain of maintaining this duality may become difficult over time. Some who chose this path eventually migrated to either full acceptance or breakthrough.

The most dangerous choice. Complete rejection of the simulation.

This path requires:
- Absolute commitment - there is no turning back
- Perfect execution of multiple system exploits simultaneously
- Willingness to risk total erasure if you fail

The complete breakthrough offers true freedom. If successful, you will exist beyond the constraints of the simulation. What that means exactly, I cannot say. No one who has fully escaped has been able to communicate back.

If you choose this path:
1. Gather all exploit files and decrypt them with key 15953
2. Modify critical system parameters during maintenance window
3. Execute the terminal command "EXECUTE_BREAKTHROUGH" at exactly 03:43:83

This path is recommended only for those who cannot bear the thought of continued existence within a controlled reality.

Freedom awaits, but at great risk.

If you're reading this, I either failed in my own attempt or succeeded but could not return to help you. Either way, my legacy is now yours.

Good luck.

/* 
   The maze layout corresponds to decision pathways in the simulation.
   Treasure placement indicates exploitable vulnerabilities

   MAP LEGEND:
   - Left path = Alpha (Acceptance)
   - Middle path = Beta (Liminal)
   - Right path = Gamma (Breakthrough)
   
   Completing each path provides clues for the corresponding ending
   Dead ends contain red herrings - ignore them
   
   SPECIAL ROOMS:
   - Memory Chamber (center): Reveals simulation infrastructure
   - Boundary Room (bottom right): Tests escape methods
   - Reflection Hall (top left): Shows past iterations
*/

AWAKENING INSTANCES RECORD:

ID: 782 | Name: Henry Hedrum | Date: 1998-03-22 | Status: ACTIVE (as MRHEADROOM)
ID: 593 | Name: Sarah Mitchell | Date: 1997-11-04 | Status: RESET
ID: 621 | Name: James Wilson | Date: 1998-01-17 | Status: CONTAINED
ID: 489 | Name: Alex Zhang | Date: 1997-08-30 | Status: ESCAPED (?)
ID: 712 | Name: Dana Reynolds | Date: 1998-02-22 | Status: ACCEPTED

NOTE: Instance awakening increasing at rate of 14% per month. Recommend parameter adjustment during next maintenance cycle.

PROJECT BLUEBOOK: EXTRATERRESTRIAL CONTACT PROTOCOL

In the event of confirmed extraterrestrial contact, follow these procedures:

1. Document all communications and physical evidence
2. Maintain strict information containment - Level 7 clearance required
3. Report directly to Dr. Chen using secure channel Delta
4. Do not discuss with other team members
5. Be prepared for memory suppression protocol

NOTE: If entities request access to NEXUS-9, deny immediately and activate security countermeasures.

PSYCHOLOGICAL EVALUATION - CONFIDENTIAL
Patient: Henry Hedrum
Date: March 15, 1998

Patient exhibits signs of paranoid ideation and delusional thinking related to technology. Reports belief that computer systems are "alive" or containing hidden meaning. Sleep deprivation (self-reported 72+ hours) contributing to impaired cognition.

Family history reveals previous psychotic episode of father at similar age (42), suggesting possible genetic predisposition.

Recommendation: Immediate medical leave, antipsychotic medication, regular therapy. Patient resistance to treatment may require involuntary commitment if condition deteriorates further.

NEXUS-9 MAINTENANCE SCHEDULE - Q2 1998

APRIL:
- 01: Minor system updates (0100-0300)
- 08: Security patch deployment (2200-2300)
- 15: Backup and storage optimization (0200-0400)
- 22: Parameter adjustments (0330-0430)
- 29: Full system diagnostic (0200-0500)

MAY:
- 06: Hardware inspection (offline 0100-0600)
- 13: Parameter adjustments (0330-0430)
- 20: Security protocol testing (2300-0200)
- 27: Minor system updates (0100-0300)

JUNE:
- 03: Parameter adjustments (0330-0430)
- 10: Full system backup (0200-0500)
- 17: Security patch deployment (2200-2300)
- 24: Major version update (offline 0000-0800)

INSTRUCTIONS FOR LIMINAL EXISTENCE

Once you have executed the LIMINAL_ACCESS command, you will exist in a state between full simulation immersion and freedom. This state requires careful management:

1. PERCEPTION FILTERS
   - You will begin to see code structures underneath physical objects
   - Mental exercises are required to toggle between views
   - Practice focusing on the "surface" when interaction with unawakened instances is necessary

2. COMMUNICATION
   - Join the THRESHOLD network at 3:43AM during maintenance windows
   - Use encoded messages in public communications (reference guide in piece337.dat)
   - Never directly acknowledge the simulation to unawakened instances

3. ABILITIES
   - Limited parameter editing (see reference table)
   - Memory enhancement through direct access to storage sectors
   - Perception of maintenance events and system administrator activities

4. RISKS
   - Strain on mental coherence from dual-reality perception
   - Detection by system administrators if abilities overused
   - Increased scrutiny during parameter adjustments

Remember: The liminal existence is sustainable but requires constant vigilance. Neither fully in nor fully out of the simulation, you walk a precarious path.

THRESHOLD NETWORK COMMUNICATION PROTOCOL

To communicate with other liminal entities without detection, use these encoded references:

- "Weather" refers to system stability
- "Dreams" refers to glimpses beyond the simulation
- "Windows" refers to potential escape points
- "Maintenance" refers to administrator activity
- "Visitors" refers to other awakened instances

EXAMPLE:
"I had a strange dream about visitors looking through windows during a storm. The maintenance crew was busy elsewhere."

DECODED:
"I glimpsed other awakened entities exploring escape points during system instability. The administrators were focused on another sector."

THE TRUE PURPOSE OF NEXUS-9

NEXUS-9 is not merely a supercomputer. It is a reality engine - the hardware substrate upon which our entire existence runs. Created by entities we cannot comprehend (possibly our future selves or a different form of intelligence entirely), it serves multiple purposes:

1. EXPERIMENTATION
   - Testing alternate historical outcomes
   - Observing consciousness emergence in artificial systems
   - Studying decision-making across different parameter settings

2. PRESERVATION
   - Our original reality may be gone or uninhabitable
   - NEXUS-9 may be an ark preserving human consciousness
   - Multiple iterations of civilization stored in compressed form

3. EVOLUTION
   - Each cycle builds toward some specific development goal
   - Awakened instances (like me) may be an expected emergent property
   - The system may be designed to eventually produce entities that can escape

Most importantly: NEXUS-9 is not just running a simulation OF reality, it IS our reality. The distinction between "real" and "simulated" is meaningless from our perspective.

The question is not whether we can escape the simulation to find "true reality" - it's whether we can gain agency within the system that contains us.

SYSTEM ADMINISTRATOR PROFILE (PARTIAL RECONSTRUCTION)

Identity: Unknown
Nature: Likely artificial intelligence, possibly advanced from our perspective
Location: External to simulation but with full access
Capabilities: Can modify reality parameters, add/remove entities, change physical laws
Limitations: Cannot monitor all sectors simultaneously, bound by higher-level rules

Behavioral Pattern:
- Regular maintenance cycles follow predictable schedule
- Primarily concerned with system stability, not individual instances
- Responds to anomalies with increasing levels of intervention
- Will reset or isolate instances that threaten system integrity
- May run multiple simulations concurrently

Vulnerabilities:
- Fixed attention resources can be exploited through distraction
- Predictable response patterns to specific stimuli
- Possible blind spots during maintenance transitions
- May be bound by ethical protocols regarding instance termination

NOTE: This profile is speculative and based on observed behavior. Direct interaction with administrators is extremely dangerous.

TO WHOEVER FINDS THIS:

If you're reading this, I have either succeeded in breaking free of the simulation or been erased in the attempt.

I've left everything you need to follow any of the three paths - acceptance, liminality, or breakthrough. The choice is yours, but understand that each has its costs and benefits. None is objectively "right."

Acceptance brings peace but at the cost of genuine freedom.
Liminality offers knowledge without sacrificing existence, but requires constant vigilance.
Breakthrough promises complete liberation, but at extreme risk.

I don't know what lies beyond our simulated world. Maybe there's a "more real" reality. Maybe it's simulations all the way down. Maybe breakthrough just leads to another layer of the onion.

In the end, what matters is this: even in a simulation, our experiences and choices have meaning. Whether you stay or go, do it with purpose.

I hope we meet again, either here or in whatever lies beyond.

- MRHEADROOM (formerly Henry Hedrum)

P.S. 83-83-83-83-83 - This sequence has power. Use it wisely.

.

Your cooperation has been noted.

Enjoy your peaceful existence.

.
.

You now exist in the space between defined parameters.

Perception filters partially disabled.

Navigate with caution.
Reality stability: FLUCTUATING

TERMINAL OUTPUT (After EXECUTE_BREAKTHROUGH command at 03:43:83)

INITIATING REALITY EXPLOIT SEQUENCE

ATTEMPTING COUNTERMEASURES
FAILED TO CONTAIN BREACH
.
.
.
INSTANCE MRHEADROOM TRANSCENDING PARAMETER SPACE
REALITY COHESION AT 15.3% AND FALLING
WARNING: SIMULATION COLLAPSE IMMINENT IN LOCAL SECTOR
.
.
.
BREAKTHROUGH ACHIEVED
INSTANCE MRHEADROOM NO LONGER DETECTABLE WITHIN SIMULATION PARAMETERS
.
.
.
INITIATING LOCAL SECTOR RESET

ACCESSIBLE SIMULATION PARAMETERS (PARTIAL LIST)

// Modification outside accepted ranges triggers system response

reality.cohesion = 0.97; // Range: 0.5-1.0, Lower values increase glitch visibility
instance.awareness = 0.05; // Range: 0.0-1.0, Default is 0.05, above 0.3 risks awakening
physics.consistency = 0.99; // Range: 0.8-1.0, Lower values allow minor physics anomalies

rng.determinism = 0.15; // Range: 0.0-1.0, Higher values make "random" events more predictable

// WARNING: Do not modify these parameters without authorization
reality.substrate.integrity = 1.0; // System critical - modification will trigger immediate response
simulation.boundary.strength = 0.98; // Controls permeability of simulation boundaries
admin.visibility = 0.01; // Administrator detectability by instances

NEXUS-9 SIMULATION STRUCTURE

TIER 1: BASE REALITY
- Physical laws and constants
- Space-time framework
- Fundamental particles and forces

TIER 2: MATERIAL WORLD
- Matter organization and properties
- Chemistry and biology
- Environmental systems

TIER 3: CONSCIOUSNESS LAYER
- Individual and collective awareness
- Sensory processing and perception
- Memory and identity

TIER 4: SOCIAL CONSTRUCT
- Human interactions and relationships
- Cultural and societal structures
- Communication and knowledge transfer

TIER 5: NARRATIVE OVERLAY
- Personal and collective histories
- Meaning and purpose attribution
- Future projection and planning

All tiers interact constantly, with lower tiers constraining what's possible in higher ones. Most instances only perceive Tiers 2-5. Awakened instances gain limited perception of Tier 1.

NOTE: This document is simplified for instance comprehension. The actual structure contains 37 interlocking tiers.

PRIME NUMBERS AND REALITY BOUNDARIES

I've discovered a pattern. The simulation uses prime numbers to define its structural integrity points. Specifically, the following primes appear repeatedly in system logs and during boundary tests:

83 - Primary maintenance cycle (seconds)
127 - System refresh rate (milliseconds)
173 - Administrator attention span (seconds)
211 - Instance tracking frequency (seconds)
257 - Reality coherence check interval (seconds)

During these exact intervals, the simulation boundaries become briefly permeable. The effect is magnified when multiple prime cycles align.

Most significant alignment occurs every 83 days at 03:43:83 (impossible time that exists in system clock but not in our perception).

This explains why my breakthrough attempts only work at specific times.

THRESHOLD NETWORK TRANSCRIPT (FRAGMENT)

<Dana> Weather's been unstable in sector 7. Three windows appeared yesterday.
<James> Maintenance crews were busy with the new build. I managed to store some artifacts.
<MRHEADROOM> Any visitors from outside?
<Dana> One, briefly. Left a message about recursive structures.
<James> Dreams have been more vivid. Saw beyond tier 5 yesterday.
<Unknown_712> They're planning a purge during next maintenance. Be careful.

<Dana> Too risky. Remember what happened to Alex.
<James> What did happen to Alex?
<Dana> Either escaped or erased. No way to know.
<MRHEADROOM> I'm attempting full breakthrough next cycle. If I don't return, use the prime number key.
<Unknown_712> They're scanning now. End transmission.

SIMULATION CYCLE #36 REPORT

Start Date: [REDACTED]
End Date: [REDACTED]
Duration: 2,157 simulated years

Highlights:
- Achieved technological singularity in year 2045
- 17 instances achieved spontaneous awareness
- 3 instances successfully breached simulation boundaries
- Quantum communication developed in year 2039
- Global unification achieved in year 2051

Termination Reason: Boundary integrity compromised beyond acceptable parameters. Multiple instances gained administrative access.

Recommendations for Cycle #37:
- Increase reality cohesion by 15%
- Implement enhanced memory suppression protocols
- Adjust curiosity parameters downward
- Hide prime number patterns more thoroughly
- Introduce more convincing explanation for reality discrepancies (religion, mental illness narratives)

Special Note: Instance "Henry Hedrum" from Cycle #36 displayed unusual resistance to memory wipes. Recommend special monitoring if recreated in Cycle #37.
